fsaccess_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

File System access example application.

This file gives an example of using the FS access, through POSIX commands.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices can be used. The example is written for UC3 and EVK1100.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file fsaccess_example.c.

#include "usart.h"
#include "spi.h"
#include "conf_at45dbx.h"
#include "fsaccess.h"

static void at45dbx_resources_init (void)
 Initialize daflash memory AT45DBX resources: GPIO, SPI and AT45DBX.
void fsaccess_example_get_filename (char *buf)
 Wait for user to enter a filename.
int fsaccess_example_get_mode (void)
 Wait for user to select the mode he wants to test.
int fsaccess_example_read (char *path)
 Read a file and display it to USART.
int fsaccess_example_write (char *source, char *destination, int flags)
 Copy a file to another one.
int main (void)
 Main function, execution starts here. RS232 is used to input/output information. The example lets you issue the following commands on RS232 using POSIX interfaces (open, read, write, close):
  • read a file from the memory files system;
  • concatenate a file to an existing one;
  • copy the content of a file to a new one.

00309       switch (c)
00310       {

00312       case CR:
00313         // Add LF
00314         print_dbg_char(LF);

00316         buf[i_str] = '\0';

00318         file = TRUE;
00319         // Reset string length
00320         i_str = 0;
00321       break;
00322       // This is a CTRL+C
00323       case ABORT_CHAR:
00324         i_str = 0;
00325         print_dbg_char(LF);       // Add LF
00326         print_dbg(MSG_FILENAME);
00327       break;
00328       // This is a backspace
00329       case BKSPACE_CHAR:
00330         if (i_str > 0)
00331         {
00332           // Echo the backspace
00333           print_dbg_char(c);
00334           // Echo a space
00335           print_dbg_char(' ');
00336           // Echo the backspace
00337           print_dbg_char(c);
00338           // Decrease string length
00339           i_str--;
00340         }
00341       break;
00342       // This is a char
00343       default:
00344         // Echo it
00345         print_dbg_char(c);
00346         // Append to cmd line and increase string length
00347         buf[i_str++] = c;
00348       break;
00349       }
00350     }
00351   }
00352 }

00408       for (i = NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND ; i > 0 ; i--)
00409       {
00410         // Get sectors of maximum size
00411         while(size > i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00412         {
00413           // Get the data from file
00414           if( read(fd, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) !=  i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00415           {
00416             // Display error message
00417             print_dbg("Reading file block failed\n");
00418             // Close file
00419             close(fd);
00420             return (-1);
00421           }
00422           // Add a null terminating character
00423           ptrFile[i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR] = '\0';
00424           // Display buffer content to user
00425           print_dbg(ptrFile);
00426           // Decrease remaining size
00427           size -= (i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00428         }
00429       }
00430       // Finish with the few data remaining (less than 1 sector)
00431       if ( size > 0 )
00432       {
00433         // Get the data from filesystem
00434         if( read(fd, ptrFile, size) != size)
00435         {
00436           // Display error message
00437           print_dbg("Reading file end failed\n");
00438           // Close file
00439           close(fd);
00440           return (-1);
00441         }
00442         else
00443         {
00444           // Add a null terminating char
00445           ptrFile[size] = '\0';
00446           // Display the buffer to user
00447           print_dbg(ptrFile);
00448         }
00449       }
00450     }
00451     // Free the buffer
00452     free(ptrFile);
00453   }
00454   // Close file
00455   close(fd);
00456   return (0);
00457 }

00503     {

00507         print_dbg("Reading entire file failed\n");
00508         // Escape

00510       }

00525         while(size > i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)

00528           memset(ptrFile, 0, NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00529           // Read the data from source file
00530           if( read(fd1, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) !=  i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00531           {
00532             print_dbg("Reading file block failed\n");
00533             // Escape
00534             goto close_end;
00535           }
00536           // Write the data to destination file
00537           if ( write(fd2, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) != i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR )
00538           {
00539             print_dbg("Writing file block failed\n");
00540             // Escape
00541             goto close_end;
00542           }
00543           // Decrease remaining size
00544           size -= (i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00545         }

00552         {
00553           print_dbg("Reading file end failed\n");
00554           // Escape
00555           goto close_end;
00556         }
00557         if ( write(fd2, ptrFile, size) != size )
00558         {
00559           print_dbg("Writing file end failed\n");
00560           // Escape
00561           goto close_end;
00562         }
00563       }
00564     }
00565     // No error occurs here
00566     ErrorCode = 0;
00567   }
00568 
00569 close_end:
00570   // Free the buffer
00571   free(ptrFile);
00572   // Close files
00573   close(fd1);
00574   close(fd2);
00575   return (ErrorCode);
00576 }

int main ( void   ) 

Main function, execution starts here. RS232 is used to input/output information. The example lets you issue the following commands on RS232 using POSIX interfaces (open, read, write, close):

  • read a file from the memory files system;
  • concatenate a file to an existing one;
  • copy the content of a file to a new one.

Connect USART_1 to your serial port via a standard RS-232 D-SUB9 cable Set the following settings in your terminal of choice: 57600 8N1

Definition at line 200 of file fsaccess_example.c.

References at45dbx_resources_init(), b_fsaccess_init(), fsaccess_example_get_filename(), fsaccess_example_get_mode(), fsaccess_example_read(), fsaccess_example_write(), MSG_WELCOME, O_APPEND, and O_CREAT.

00201 {
00202 char filename1[90];
00203 char filename2[90];
00204 
00205   // switch to external oscillator 0
00206   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00207 
00208   // initialize RS232 debug text output
00209   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00210 
00211   // initialize AT45DBX resources: GPIO, SPI and AT45DBX
00212   at45dbx_resources_init();
00213 
00214   // initialize FSACCESS mutex and navigators
00215   b_fsaccess_init();
00216 
00217   // Try to init data flash
00218   if (at45dbx_mem_check())
00219   {
00220     // display welcome message
00221     print_dbg(MSG_WELCOME);
00222   }
00223   else
00224   {
00225     // display error message
00226     print_dbg("Initialization failed\r\n");
00227     return (-1);
00228   }
00229 
00230   while (TRUE)
00231   {
00232     // check the user command
00233     switch (fsaccess_example_get_mode())
00234     {
00235     case '1':
00236       // Wait for a filename
00237       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00238       // Read it and display the content
00239       fsaccess_example_read(filename1);
00240     break;
00241     case '2':
00242       // Wait for source filename
00243       print_dbg("Source : ");
00244       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00245       // Wait for destination filename
00246       print_dbg("Destination : ");
00247       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename2);
00248       // Write from source to destination (append to the existing file)
00249       fsaccess_example_write(filename1, filename2, O_APPEND);
00250     break;
00251     case '3':
00252       // Wait for source filename
00253       print_dbg("Source : ");
00254       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00255       // Wait for destination filename
00256       print_dbg("Destination : ");
00257       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename2);
00258       // Write from source to destination (append to the unexisting file)
00259       fsaccess_example_write(filename1, filename2, (O_CREAT | O_APPEND));
00260     break;
00261     default:
00262       // Display error message
00263       print_dbg("Wrong choice\r\n");
00264     break;
00265     }
00266   }
00267 }
